intro: Scabiosa caesaraugustana, commonly known as the Augustan scabious, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny grasslands and rocky soils, preferring well-drained conditions. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in fine hairs. Scabiosa caesaraugustana is valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting pollinators.
